remarks: Equivalence of an onto mapping and dominance for a nonempty finite set. Unlike ~ fodomb for arbitrary sets, this theorem does not require the Axiom of Choice for its proof.  (Contributed by NM, 23-Mar-2006.)
statement:
fodomfib $p |- ( A e. Fin -> ( ( A =/= (/) /\ E. f f : A -onto-> B ) <-> ( (/) ~< B /\ B ~<_ A ) ) ) $.
$d A f $.
$d B f $.
